g.H5971: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
g.H408: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
g.H2040: to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
g.H6435: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
g.H6555: to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)

g.H3381: to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); ...
g.H413: near, with or among; often in general, to
g.H5971: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
